alert.note: Alert for Estill; Powell (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 03 at 7:30AM EST until January 03 at 10:00PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kentucky... Red River at Clay City affecting Powell and Estill Counties. .The river has crested at Clay City and will continue to slowly fall. For the Red River...including Clay City...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Red River at Clay City. * WHEN...Until late this evening. * IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, Moderate flooding begins. Several roads are impassable in and around Clay City. Some homes are flooded in low lying areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:15 AM EST Monday the stage was 19.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:15 AM EST Monday was 20.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this afternoon and continue falling to 5.7 feet Friday evening. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 19.4 feet on 01/11/1974. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued 5 PM EST.
